page.title: 07Frocester Estate Barn.
page.content: When we visited the Owner was slowly re-roofing the house,with the Stone Tiles.He told us he had re-roofed the Barn over several years. The Great Tithe or Estate Barn dates from 1280-1285 & is one of the largest in the country.It is built of local Limestone with a stone tile roof & is 186'long x 30'wide.The well buttressed walls are 12' to the eaves and it is 36'to the roof ridge.The timbers are massive,mostly of Oak and Elm with the addition of Deal put in during repair. The original roof was destroyed by fire in the early 16th.century but was probably replaced to the old pattern. It was interesting to see the massive building still being used for farming purposes.The nearby buildings are C16- C19th.and have been adapted to present needs and are linked with modern farm structures,so using old and new.
